Articles.Content: Tell us what you also do! Besides KSP of course. I like physics, and want to be an astrophysicist one day.
Im going to fly one day...
RC planes and sailing
Sleeping, music, and poetry. All three are fine arts.
Guns, history in general, military, boxing, shooting wif guns, etc.
Programming, modelling, drawing, scale-building, gaming, fixing computers.

Drawing

I am teh BAWSE

40K

And drawing, I guess. I wanna sell my drawings to make money to buy 40K with

Another 40K-er here.

Reading (Does that count as a hobby?).

Just getting into a new one - a few weird events have let me discover I have a very good Kermit the Frog voice, so now I\'m building a puppet to teach myself ventriloquism!

Another 40K-er here.

Reading (Does that count as a hobby?).

Just getting into a new one - a few weird events have let me discover I have a very good Kermit the Frog voice, so now I\'m building a puppet to teach myself ventriloquism!

Yes it does, I used to read a lot, but I kind of grew away from it
Reading articles or books, playing/watching football (American), watching movies
- Bump -
gaming and reading

Homestuck

Costuming

Minecraft

Dungeon Mastering

Designing Tabletop RPGs

Cons, I really really love going to Conventions. Costuming kind of fits in there. Oh and Homestuck.

Please tell me you don\'t dress up and go to Star-Trek cons.... PLEASE!!

I often partake in the following -

Reading

Gaming

3D Modeling

Texturing 3D models (getting better at it, \'twas horrible last June)

General Computing (Internet, etc.)

Performing the below

And then I also partake in the various musical and canvas-based arts -

I\'m a violinist and a pianist, and have a spare set of paints, brushes, and canvases for painting.

I\'ll give some more of mine:

Legos (Not the kiddie kind, I build things that take months, like replicas of battleships)

Programming (I suck at it!)

Reading (I read a chapter book every week.)

Erm, let me see...

Reading (I can easily read a 1000-page book on any topic in a day or two, unless it\'s a textbook or something.)

Drawing (Not sketches and stuff, things like architectural design)

Computer-ing (Should go without saying)

Playing the trumpet (Been playing it since the fifth grade, so I\'m pretty good at it)

Gaming (Mostly computer games and free-roam type things; Minecraft, GTA, KSP, etc.)

Sleeping (I used to hate it when I was a kid, now sleep is the most precious part of the day)

Physics-type stuff (I might want to be an astrophysicist)

And about a billion other things. In essence, I\'m the generic nerd-gamer stereotype.
